messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:23): hah, I think I nailed it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:23): running tests it doesn't seem slower so far
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:24): time to update the tests
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:39): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, one of your tests has a bug
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:40): hmm
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:41): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: oh. which one?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:41): foo<!--></bar><!-->baz</bar>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:41): <!--> is either a single comment or the start of one
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:42): it's certainly not character data
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:42): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: why not?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:42): after the first </bar> is emitted you switch to PCDATA
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:43): we do at least, I suppose that could differ per implementation
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:44): oh, right. the latter one
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:44): yeah, the second
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:44): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: <!--> can be the start of a comment?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:44): it also says "end tag surrounded"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:44): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, that was previously the case
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:45): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, that should also be changed I suppose
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:45): I start to suspect my test harness or impl is broken
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:46): brokenness with harness
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:47): my impl is totally b0rked, too
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:55): my harness was so b0rked it isn't even funny
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:57): another advantage of multiple implementations
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): our test coverage is pretty good btw
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): each change I make triggers at least one error in the testsuite
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:05): I usually add some regression tests while I'm at it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:12): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: has the handling of <!--> in PCDATA changed since June 17th?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:12): yes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:12): there are two new comment states to handle <!--> and <!---> as near-empty incorrect comments
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:13): I guess I have to go diffing the spec again
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:13): you misunderstand, this is a good thing :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (17:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:16): I think I'll implement that now and see what breaks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:38): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, I checked in basic <!--> and <!---> tokenizer tests
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:42): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'm seeing two failures w/python, is that what you are seeing?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): I have three
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): I suspect one of them is just something on my side
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): There's one failure in escapeFlag, but that's because the testcase has to be fixed
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:43): do a svn up... you might not have t.broyer's fix
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): and there's a failure with respect to newlines
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:43): I've no idea how to fix that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:44): I got his fixes
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:44): when the code stabilizes, I'll take a look at test_newlines
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (17:48): ... which I guess is now (down to one failure)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:49): yeah, for the moment
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:00): cool
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (18:02): planning to break more stuff?  :-)  Or is it safe to try to port these changes to Ruby now?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:04): heh, I think I'll stop doing html5lib for the rest of the day
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:08): things we need to do at some point:
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:08): * fix the new innerHTML stuff (adding a newline for <pre> and <textarea>)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:08): * fix <isindex>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:08): * implement almost standards mode
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:08): * <p></body>
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (18:09): "almost standards mode" doesn't apply to fragments, does it?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:10): currently quirks mode and almost standards mode don't affect parsing at all
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:10): they're just determined during tree construction
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (18:12): why did you comment out #import hotshot, hotshot.stats in mockParser?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:13): oh, that happened on accident I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:13): I don't have hotshot here and wanted to play with the other parts
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (18:13): ok, I'll include that in my next commit.
a480104b0e570389c6f4284a88c7cd9d (18:14): I'll move the import down to where it is needed
